meanings.definition: The quality of being reserved or reticent in behavior or communication.
meanings.sent1: Her reservednesses made it difficult for others to get to know her.
meanings.sent2: His reservednesses often made people think he was shy.
meanings.sent3: Despite his reservednesses, he still managed to make friends easily.
meanings.sent4: The reservednesses in her demeanor hid a deep well of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's reservednesses in class made the students curious about her personal life.

meanings.definition: The state of holding back or keeping to oneself.
meanings.sent1: The reservednesses of the child worried the parents.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of reservednesses when sharing her thoughts with others.
meanings.sent3: His reservednesses with desserts led to him missing out on the delicious treats.
meanings.sent4: The reservednesses of the lake before the storm hinted at the impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The reservednesses of the old house gave it an air of mystery.
